instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on but hot ram after ultrasonic
threads.message:
Hello,
on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (waterdamage) replacing some stuff (especially around the SMC) i get a green light for a second and than only a orange light in the charger even there is no battery connected. Before i cleaned it the cpu was getting warm (with orange light ; i did not recognize warm ram) and now after i cleaned it in a ultrasonic just the ram is getting warm. Not the cpu any longer. i think it is only <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> getting hot. The other 3 chips are warm too but not as warm as <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. Also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is only 1,6V and shorted (0,002V to GND on F7140). If i inject 1V in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> is also getting warm a bit and its drawing aroung 1A from my supply. I have no idea what to check now.
Thanks for any help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on but hot ram after ultrasonic
threads.message: Shorted high side FET in RAM supply. Pretty sure this board is toasted, avoid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on but hot ram after ultrasonic
threads.message: OK, thank you very much. Sorry for the dumb question. Have you any idea how this could happen? Because iÂ´m pretty sure it was working (or at least had a warm cpu not hot ram) after i finished soldering / before the cleaner. I thought maybe a component fell of the board or something...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on but hot ram after ultrasonic
threads.message: Could be anything. Most likely is a trace/resistor that was hanging on by a thread got destroyed in the U/S. This may have caused the RAM power supply to go high frying the RAM/CPU.
